problem.markdown:
A clock manufacturer has found that the amount of time their clocks gain or lose per week is normally distributed with a mean of 0 minutes and a standard deviation of 0.5 minute, as shown below.

>>In a random sample of 1,500 of their clocks, what is to the expected number of clocks that would gain or lose more than 1 minute per week?<< = 70
problem.p: A clock manufacturer has found that the amount of time their clocks gain or lose per week is normally distributed with a mean of 0 minutes and a standard deviation of 0.5 minute, as shown below.
In a random sample of 1,500 of their clocks, what is to the expected number of clocks that would gain or lose more than 1 minute per week?

formulaequationinput.label: In a random sample of 1,500 of their clocks, what is to the expected number of clocks that would gain or lose more than 1 minute per week?
